div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-EehZO jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Elm Creek School District's mission is to... Educate all students based on high educational standards. Support a safe environment that welcomes diversity and mutual respect among adults and students. Prepare all students, in cooperation with staff, family and community, to be well-rounded contributing members of society.

div.p: SCHOOL IS CLOSED UNTIL 04/01/2020. (Will be updated as necessary)

p.a: Steps to download Zoom for Students

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: In an effort to improve the quality of education at Elm Creek Public Schools the School Improvement Team is asking that you would take the time to fill out this survey if you graduated in the class of 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, and 2019. Responses are anonymous and will be taken through the end of the school year (May 15, 2020).

div.p: The Elm Creek Public School District hereby gives this statement of compliance and intends to comply with all state and federal laws prohibiting discrimination. This school district intends to take any necessary measures to assure compliance with such laws against any prohibited form of discrimination.

The Elm Creek Public School District does not discriminate on the basis of sex, disability, race, color, religion, veteran status, national or ethnic origin, marital status, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical condition, or other protected status in its programs and activities and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following persons have been designated to handle inquiries regarding the non-discrimination policies:
Elementary Students: Derrick Pulliam, Principal, 230 East Calkins Ave., Elm Creek, NE 68836, (308) 856-4953, derrick.pulliam@elmcreekschools.org
Secondary Students: Cory Spotanski, Principal, 230 East Calkins Ave., Elm Creek, NE 68836, (308) 856-4300, cory.spotanski@elmcreekschools.org
Employees and Others: Tom Reeser, Superintendent 230 East Calkins Ave., Elm Creek, NE 68836, (308) 856-4300, tom.reeser@elmcreekschools.org

Complaints or concerns involving discrimination or needs for accommodation or access should be addressed to the appropriate Coordinator. For further information about anti-discrimination laws and regulations, or to file a complaint of discrimination with the Office for Civil Rights in the U.S. Department of Education (OCR), please contact OCR at 601 East 12th Street, Room 353, Kansas City, MO 64106, (800) 368-1019 (voice), Fax (816) 426-3686, (800) 537-7697 (telecommunications device for the deaf), or ocr.kansascity@ed.gov.
